009package imagingbook.common.ij;
010
011import java.awt.Polygon;
012
013import ij.gui.OvalRoi;
014import ij.gui.PointRoi;
015import ij.gui.PolygonRoi;
016import ij.gui.Roi;
017import ij.process.FloatPolygon;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019
020/**
021 * This class defines static ROI-related utility methods
022 * to interface with ImageJ.
023 * 
024 * @author WB
025 * @version 2022/09/22
026 */
027public class RoiUtils {
028        
029        private RoiUtils() {}
030        
031        /**
032         * Retrieves the outline of the specified ROI as an array of {@link Pnt2d}
033         * points with {@code int} coordinates. Note that unless the ROI is of type
034         * {@link PolygonRoi} or {@link PointRoi} only the corner points of the bounding
035         * box are returned. Interpolated contour points are returned for a instance of
036         * {@link OvalRoi}.
037         * 
038         * @param roi the ROI
039         * @return the ROI's polygon coordinates
040         */
041        public static Pnt2d[] getOutlinePointsInt(Roi roi) {
042                Polygon pgn = roi.getPolygon();
043                Pnt2d[] pts = new Pnt2d[pgn.npoints];
044                for (int i = 0; i < pgn.npoints; i++) {
045                        pts[i] = Pnt2d.PntInt.from(pgn.xpoints[i], pgn.ypoints[i]);
046                }
047                return pts;
048        }
049        
050        /**
051         * Retrieves the outline of the specified ROI as an array of {@link Pnt2d}
052         * points with {@code double} coordinates. Returned coordinates are measured
053         * relative to the pixel center, e.g., (5.0, 3.0) is assumed to be in the middle
054         * of pixel (5, 3). This method retrieves ROI points with
055         * {@link Roi#getFloatPolygon()} but applies type-dependent correction for
056         * consistent point rendering.
057         * 
058         * @param roi the {@link Roi}
059         * @return the ROI's outline coordinates
060         */
061        public static Pnt2d[] getOutlinePointsFloat(Roi roi) {
062//              final double offset = (isAreaRoi(roi)) ? -0.5 : 0.0; // replaced by Roi#isLineOrPoint() with IJ 1.53v
063                final double offset = (roi.isLineOrPoint()) ? 0.0 : -0.5; // shift area rois to pixel centers
064                FloatPolygon poly = roi.getFloatPolygon();
065                return getPoints(poly, offset);
066        }
067        
068        /**
069         * Extracts the points of an ImageJ {@link FloatPolygon}.
070         * @param poly the original polygon
071         * @param offset x/y offset to add to coordinates (typically -0.5 for "area ROIs")
072         * @return the polygon's vertex points
073         */
074        public static Pnt2d[] getPoints(FloatPolygon poly, double offset) {
075                Pnt2d[] pts = new Pnt2d[poly.npoints];
076                for (int i = 0; i < poly.npoints; i++) {
077                        pts[i] = Pnt2d.from(poly.xpoints[i] + offset, poly.ypoints[i] + offset);
078                }
079                return pts;
080        }
081        
082        /**
083         * Extracts the points of an ImageJ {@link FloatPolygon}.
084         * Calls {@link #getPoints(FloatPolygon, double)} with zero offset.
085         * @param poly the original polygon
086         * @return the polygon's vertex points
087         */
088        public static Pnt2d[] getPoints(FloatPolygon poly) {
089                return getPoints(poly, 0.0);
090        }
091        
092        /**
093         * Converts an array of 2D points (of type {@link Pnt2d}) to a {@link PointRoi}
094         * instance.
095         * 
096         * @param points v
097         * @return a {@link PointRoi} instance
098         */
099        public static PointRoi toPointRoi(Pnt2d[] points) {
100                PointRoi roi = new PointRoi();
101                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
102                        roi.addPoint(p.getX(), p.getY());
103                }
104                return roi;
105        }
106        
107}
